column1: '''''súlë''''' (older '''''thúlë''''' or '''''þúlë''''') is a noun meaning "spirit" in [[Quenya]].<ref name="Names">{{App
column2: Letters}}, Note, ''The names of the letters''</ref>

left]]''Súlë'' is also the name in Quenya of the ninth letter of the [[Tengwar]] alphabet.<ref name="Names"/>  It is the first letter of the third grade or [[Tyellë]], which contains "voiceless spirants" and it is the third letter in the dental or ''t''-series of consonants, the ''[[Tincotéma]]''.  In all modes except for later Quenya, ''Súlë'' represents '''TH'''.<ref>{{App
column3: Letters}}</ref>  The Westron name for this letter is '''''Thó'''''.<ref>See [[Westron Tengwar]]</ref>

column1: <!-- The extra spacing above this section cannot be removed without the title for History being shifted to the right. -->

The original name of ''Súlë'' was ''þúlë'' and in Quenya it had the value '''TH''' or '''þ'''. The alteration of its value occurred among the [[Noldor]] while in [[Valinor]].  The change angered [[Fëanor]] for he felt it was an insult to change the pronunciation of the [[Mother-name
column2: mother-name]] of his mother [[Míriel]], which was ''[[þerindë]]''.<ref group="note">For more about this politicized linguistic debate, see [[The Shibboleth of Fëanor#The case of the Quenya change of þ > s
column3: The Shibboleth of Fëanor]].</ref>  However, the mutation of '''þ''' to '''S''' continued and eventually this letter was renamed ''Súlë'' and in Quenya only has the value '''S''' (and is only used instead of letters 29 or 30 when the original sound in a word was "þ").<ref>{{PM

column1: The word derives from the [[Primitive Quendian]] [[Sundocarme
